articles.headline: Erdogan’s Party in Turkey Regains Parliamentary Majority
articles.snippet: The results of a snap election represent a stunning electoral comeback, and ensure another period of single-party government in Turkey.
articles.abstract: The results of a snap election represent a stunning electoral comeback, and ensure another period of single-party government in Turkey.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — In a stunning electoral comeback, the Islamist party of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan regained its majority in Parliament on Sunday, ensuring Mr. Erdogan’s continued dominance of Turkish politics after months of political turmoil and violence.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Ceylan Yeginsu

articles.headline: Amid Vigils and Debris, Officials Seek Cause of Sinai Peninsula Crash
articles.snippet: A day of mourning was held Sunday for 224 who died in the Egyptian Sinai crash, while the transportation minister said flight recorders had been found.
articles.abstract: A day of mourning was held Sunday for 224 who died in the Egyptian Sinai crash, while the transportation minister said flight recorders had been found.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia — As Russia mourned the 224 victims of a charter flight that crashed over the weekend on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, investigators on Sunday began the difficult process of trying to determine whether the plane, which they said had broken up in midair, was brought down by an act of terrorism or a tragic accident.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Neil MacFarquhar

articles.headline: Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio Grow Apart as Their Ambitions Expand
articles.snippet: The senators brought similar backgrounds and Tea Party fervor to Washington, but any alliance between them frayed as they moved closer to seeking the White House.
articles.abstract: The senators brought similar backgrounds and Tea Party fervor to Washington, but any alliance between them frayed as they moved closer to seeking the White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When he ran for the Senate from Texas in 2012, Ted Cruz welcomed the comparisons on Capitol Hill and in the news media to Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, another 41-year-old Cuban-American and oratorically gifted conservative, who had ridden a wave of Tea Party support two years earlier to victory over his state’s Republican establishment.

articles.headline: In Arbitration, a ‘Privatization of the Justice System’
articles.snippet: Forced individual arbitration often bears little resemblance to court: The rules tend to favor businesses, and judges and juries are replaced by arbitrators whose rulings are difficult to appeal.
articles.abstract: Forced individual arbitration often bears little resemblance to court: The rules tend to favor businesses, and judges and juries are replaced by arbitrators whose rulings are difficult to appeal.
articles.lead_paragraph: Deborah L. Pierce, an emergency room doctor in Philadelphia, was optimistic when she brought a sex discrimination claim against the medical group that had dismissed her. Respected by colleagues, she said she had a stack of glowing evaluations and evidence that the practice had a pattern of denying women partnerships.

articles.headline: San Francisco Ballots Turn Up Anger Over the Technical Divide
articles.snippet: On Tuesday, voters will weigh in on propositions linked to the technology industry and rising housing costs, including one to restrict Airbnb’s home-sharing.
articles.abstract: On Tuesday, voters will weigh in on propositions linked to the technology industry and rising housing costs, including one to restrict Airbnb’s home-sharing.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Bruce Bennett is 52 and has a bum knee in need of surgery. But two Sundays ago he put on a knee brace and huffed his way up steep hills and dozens of stairs to implore residents to vote against a city measure called Proposition F.

articles.headline: Lionsgate Seeks to Build on Its Library of Film Properties With Theme Parks
articles.snippet: Roller coasters and other rides based on the “Hunger Games” movies will anchor new theme parks in the United States and China, the studio’s chief brand officer said.
articles.abstract: Roller coasters and other rides based on the “Hunger Games” movies will anchor new theme parks in the United States and China, the studio’s chief brand officer said.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Katniss Everdeen, theme park queen?

articles.headline: Lotto Campaign Ribbing the Rich Seizes a Moment
articles.snippet: The advertising industry has made the caricature of the rich snob who doesn’t know, or care, about the struggles of ordinary Americans a popular target.
articles.abstract: The advertising industry has made the caricature of the rich snob who doesn’t know, or care, about the struggles of ordinary Americans a popular target.
articles.lead_paragraph: Meet advertising’s favorite new villains: the ultrarich.

articles.headline: The Hustle of Publishing Art News in the Postprint Era
articles.snippet: The Brooklyn Rail, an art newspaper that a founder began mostly with money from a sold painting, is ready to leave its month-to-month existence behind.
articles.abstract: The Brooklyn Rail, an art newspaper that a founder began mostly with money from a sold painting, is ready to leave its month-to-month existence behind.
articles.lead_paragraph: Phong Bui, an artist and curator and a founder of the art newspaper The Brooklyn Rail, makes an unlikely media executive.

articles.headline: Fake Cover Letters Expose Discrimination Against Disabled
articles.snippet: Employers were less likely to respond to applicants who said they had a disability, researchers show.
articles.abstract: Employers were less likely to respond to applicants who said they had a disability, researchers show.
articles.lead_paragraph: Employers appear to discriminate against well-qualified job candidates who have a disability, researchers at Rutgers and Syracuse universities have concluded.

articles.headline: Chinese Manager of Highflying Funds Is Arrested in Insider Trading Case
articles.snippet: The Shanghai investment firm of Xu Xiang, known as China’s Carl Icahn, was the subject of intense market speculation in September.
articles.abstract: The Shanghai investment firm of Xu Xiang, known as China’s Carl Icahn, was the subject of intense market speculation in September.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — He has been called China’s Carl Icahn. But the billionaire owner of one of the country’s most successful investment firms is now the latest suspect in a broadening crackdown on corruption in the financial industry.
